instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
No liquid or drop damage. SSD just randomly stopped being detected.  Tried known good ssd.

Replaced <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 no change.

<CHIP>U3740</CHIP> pin 6 3.2V pin 7 0.380v pin 8 0V   pin 3 3.2V    pin 4 3.4v

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
Do you get 100MHz PCIE clock for SSD?
SSD is not recognized at all in Disk Utility?

Check <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
not sure about  100MHz PCIE clock for SSD, do not have a oscilloscope.

SSD not recognized at all in disk utility.

Changed <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 but no change. Traces are fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message: Compare voltage readings on SSD connector lines with another board, using similar kind of SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PCIE_SSD_R2D</SIGNAL> .338v on bad board and 0.515v on good board. Bad CPU since <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 are already replaced???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO SSD
threads.message:
What is <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> level on bad and good board?
Of course, check with SSD inserted.
